intro: Silene dschuparensis, commonly known as the Dschupar Valley catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Silene dschuparensis is a rare species, often found in limited geographic areas, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
